Question
========

Which two events below are *independent* of each other?

Answerlist
----------

* Suppose event X is blood type AB in the United States and Y is blood type AB in China.
* Event A is the age of any person and B is whether or not that person has successfully completed college.
* Take a shuffled deck of cards and draw a clover card as Event A and then draw another clover card as Event B.
* A = {all numbers from 0 to 1}; B = {0}.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Suppose event X is the blood type AB in the United States and Y is the blood type AB in China...: Correct
* Event A is the age of a random person and B is whether or not that person has successfully completed college: Incorrect
* Take a shuffled deck of cards and draw a clover card as event A and then draw another clover card as event B.: Incorrect
* A = {all numbers from 0 to 1}; B = {0}...: Incorrect
